squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx

Class SquidTextPanel<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
        • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx.GroupCombinedPanel<T>
          • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx.SquidTextPanel<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Cullable, squidpony.panel.ICombinedPanel<T>
    Deprecated. 
    Use TextPanel instead

    @Deprecated
public abstract class SquidTextPanel<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color>
extends GroupCombinedPanel<T>
    A panel to display some text. It can either compute its size on its own or use preallocated panels to determine its size.

    This class is somehow doing a simpler business as ButtonsPanel but they did not get merged, because ButtonsPanel would then become a monster.

    This class is deprecated. You should likely use TextPanel instead, because it directly relies on libgdx for rendering and hence has a more "flowing" display, where variable-width fonts can be used, and that is more appropriate for text. Moreover TextPanel uses more recent stuff (such as GDXMarkup), supports scrolling, and is more memory efficient (no backing SquidPanel -> save on allocated arrays).

    Author:
    smelC
    See Also:
    ButtonsPanel

      • text

        protected List<squidpony.panel.IColoredString<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color>> text
        Deprecated. 

      • maxWidth

        public int maxWidth
        Deprecated. 
        The maximum width that this panel can take (in number of cells). This is a pretty much random value. Overwrite it with something computed from your game (for example, use your dungeon's width if you display it entirely, and want this panel fullscreen).

      • maxHeight

        public int maxHeight
        Deprecated. 
        The maximum height that this panel can take (in number of cells). This is a pretty much random value. Overwrite it with something computed from your game (for example, use your dungeon's height if you display it entirely, and want this panel fullscreen).
